Key Match Events: Kelly Oubre Jr hit three of his four three-point attempts in the first quarter.
Eric Gordon scored ten points off the bench in the second quarter.
Jaylen Wells scored 14 first-half points for the Grizzlies.
Ja Morant dished seven first-half assists.
Ja Morant asserted himself early in the third quarter to push the Grizzlies' lead into double digits.
Jay Huff scored 20 points and pulled down five rebounds for the Grizzlies.
Jared McCain tried to make a push in the fourth quarter, cutting the lead down to 14 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia 76ers were looking to bounce back from their loss to the Detroit Pistons.
The Sixers were without Paul George and Joel Embiid due to knee injuries.
The Grizzlies were without Desmond Bane, Marcus Smart, and a few other players.
Post-Match Reflections: Head coach Nick Nurse commented on the Sixers' difficulties with rebounding and guarding the low post.
Nick Nurse mentioned the need to explore filling the power forward spot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sixers were outrebounded 52-33, including 11 offensive rebounds.
The Grizzlies dominated the paint, scoring 70 points to the Sixers' 34.
